definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to take off/to remove (one's hat, a door from its hinges etc)/to pick (a piece of fruit from a tree etc)/(sports) to pick off (a rebound etc)
digest (of literature)/to make a digest (of data)/summary
lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation
lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation

sentences.english: Old black Joe still pickin ' cotton.
sentences.chinese: 老黑人乔仍然在摘棉花。

sentences.english: We are going to pick apples next week.
sentences.chinese: 下星期我们打算去摘苹果。

sentences.english: The day before we went to class in Guangxi countryside, Quzhai a strawberry.
sentences.chinese: 前天我们班集体去了八桂田园，去摘了草莓。

sentences.english: Diminishing marginal returns are like pickingapples.
sentences.chinese: 边际收益递减像摘苹果。

sentences.english: She stooped to pick a flower.
8. Pick a dandelion that has gone to seed.
sentences.chinese: 摘一个已经结子的蒲公英。

sentences.english: And I am responsible for gathering the berries for you all to taste later.
sentences.chinese: 我负责给大家摘野果，尝个新鲜嘛。

sentences.english: I went to my student 's orchard to pick peaches and pears .
sentences.chinese: 我到学生的果园去摘桃子和梨。

sentences.english: I'll go and pick us some grapefruits .
Having watered the vegetables, they began to pick up the apples.
sentences.chinese: 他们浇完了蔬菜之后，就开始摘苹果。

sentences.english: According to the archives, our Chinese ancestors began using stilts to help them gather fruits from trees.
sentences.chinese: 根据记载，我们的祖先踩高跷是为了从树上摘果子。

sentences.english: The teacher and his son are picking apples now.
sentences.chinese: 老师和他的儿子在摘苹果。

sentences.english: Stick a vase on the table for those flowers I got.
sentences.chinese: 在桌上放个花瓶，把我摘的花都放进去吧。

sentences.english: If you're ready to work, let's pick some apples.
sentences.chinese: 你要是准备了工作了，我们就一起摘苹果。

sentences.english: Having watered the vegetables, they began to pick the apples.
sentences.chinese: 他们浇完了蔬菜之后就开始摘苹果。

definition: to take off/to remove (one's hat, a door from its hinges etc)/to pick (a piece of fruit from a tree etc)/(sports) to pick off (a rebound etc)
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
